To edit the menu navigation of your web portal, you need to navigate to **structure > menus > main navigation** via the
administration toolbar (menu).

After clicking on **main navigation** you can see all  menu items available in your web portal main navigation. You can
add new menu items and edit already available menu items.

## Add a new main navigation menu item

To add a new menu item to your web portal navigation, click the **add link** button. You can add the menu name and URL
in the appropriate fields and click **save** to add your menu item.

## Move the position of a menu item in the main navigation

You can easily move the position of menu items by moving them up or down (drag & drop).

## Create a submenu item in the main navigation

To create a submenu item, you first need to add a menu item as explained above. Once the menu item is available in the list,
you need to drag the menu item just below its main menu item and move it to the right. I will become an inset of the main
menu item.

## Enable or disable a main navigation menu item

Via the main navigation overview, which you can access when you navigate to **structure > menus > main navigation** via the
administration toolbar, you can easily disable or enable main navigation (sub)menu items. Select the **Enabled** check to
show the menu item in the main navigation or deselect the **Enabled** checkbox to hide the menu item in the main navigation.

## Edit the name of your project portal

Upon instantiation of your project web portal, the name of your project will be set to display in the top left corner in
the header section, left from the main menu navigation, and in the footer. The acronym and/or full name will use the primary
site colors.

To edit this text, you navigate to **website settings** in the navigation toolbar (menu) and select **site settings**.
You will be able to edit the site name and slogan. Click **save configuration** to save your changes.
